title: Business & Finance
text:
Google and Apple would have to open their app stores to alternative payment systems in South Korea under a bill passed by that country's National Assembly.

---

U.S. stocks slipped Tuesday, but major indexes posted gains for the month. The S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow rose 2.9%, 4% and 1.2%, respectively, in August.

---

Home-price growth in the U.S. climbed to a record in June as robust demand continued to outpace the number of homes on the market.

---

Eurozone inflation hit its highest level in almost a decade in August, with broad consumer prices 3% higher than a year earlier.

---

China Evergrande said work has been suspended on some of its real-estate projects and warned it could default on its borrowings if it can't resolve liquidity problems.

---

Fidelity Investments plans to hire another 9,000 employees this year to help keep pace with a surge in demand for its services.

---

Jury selection began in the criminal fraud trial of Theranos founder Holmes.

---

Mike Richards was fired from his job as executive producer of "Jeopardy!"

---

Allbirds , which is known for its eco-friendly sneakers, has filed for an IPO.
